benefits.title: Impact of Glucosamine Supplementation on Gut Health
benefits.summary: Glucosamine supplementation significantly reduces stomach bloating and shows a trend towards reducing constipation and hard stools.

benefits.title: What is the current status of chondroitin sulfate and glucosamine for the treatment of knee osteoarthritis?
benefits.summary: Glucosamine sulfate has a beneficial effect on pain and function, and reduces the rate of joint space narrowing in knee osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: Sulfate could mediate the therapeutic effect of glucosamine sulfate.
benefits.summary: Oral glucosamine sulfate increases serum sulfate concentrations, providing a plausible biochemical mechanism for its reported beneficial effects on osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: The effects of oral glucosamine on joint health: is a change in research approach needed?
benefits.summary: Oral glucosamine has potential therapeutic benefits in alleviating the pain and disability of osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: Molecular mechanisms and biomedical applications of glucosamine as a potential multifunctional therapeutic agent.
benefits.summary: Glucosamine has beneficial pharmacological effects to relieve osteoarthritis symptoms and is a promising candidate for the prevention and/or treatment of other diseases due to its anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory activities.

benefits.title: Dietary and viscosupplementation in ankle arthritis.
benefits.summary: Glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate are dietary supplements that manage symptoms associated with osteoarthritis, with promising results in knee osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: Relationship between glucosamine use and the risk of lung cancer: data from a nationwide prospective cohort study
benefits.summary: Regular use of glucosamine is significantly related to a 16% lower risk of lung cancer and a 12% decreased risk of lung cancer mortality.

benefits.title: Glucosamine Interferes With Myelopoiesis and Enhances the Immunosuppressive Activity of Myeloid-Derived Suppressor Cells
benefits.summary: Glucosamine promotes the production of immature myeloid cells and enhances the immunosuppressive ability of myeloid-derived suppressor cells, potentially offering new therapeutic benefits.

benefits.title: A review on the effects of glucosamine for knee osteoarthritis based on human and animal studies
benefits.summary: Glucosamine has shown some evidence of beneficial effects on joint structural repair in animals, but further research is needed to confirm its applicability in humans.

benefits.title: Papel da glucosamina no alívio dos sintomas da osteoartrose: revisão baseada na evidência
benefits.summary: Glucosamine is not clinically significant in relieving pain and improving joint function in osteoarthritis, but it is safe.

side effects.title: Oral glucosamine increases expression of transforming growth factor β1 (TGFβ1) and connective tissue growth factor (CTGF) mRNA in rat cartilage and kidney: implications for human efficacy and toxicity.
side effects.summary: Oral glucosamine may induce tissue TGFÎ± and CTGF expression, suggesting potential sclerotic side-effects may occur.

side effects.title: Use of a glycosamine sulfate for patients with osteoarthritis and a comorbidity with high risk of the side effects from NSAIDS.
side effects.summary: Patented microcrystalline glucosamine sulfate (pCGS) can cause a decrease of COX-2 and PGE2 gene expression, potentially reducing the risk of side effects from NSAIDS.

side effects.title: Effect of Glucosamine Sulfate on Hip Osteoarthritis
side effects.summary: No clinically significant effect on pain, function, or joint space narrowing was found after 2 years of treatment with glucosamine in hip osteoarthritis patients.

side effects.title: [The effect of glucosamine sulphate on the blood levels of cholesterol or triglycerides--a clinical study].
side effects.summary: Glucosamine sulphate does not significantly influence blood levels of cholesterol or triglycerides, and there were no differences in side-effects between the treatment groups.

side effects.title: Sodium alginate nanoparticles as a new transdermal vehicle of glucosamine sulfate for treatment of osteoarthritis
side effects.summary: Glucosamine sulfate may have side effects on the gastrointestinal tract when taken orally for osteoarthritis treatment.

side effects.title: Effect of Glucosamine Conjugate-Functionalized Liposomes on Glioma Cell and Healthy Brain: An Insight for Future Application in Brain Infusion
side effects.summary: D-glucosamine conjugate-functionalized liposomes are non-toxic to normal brain tissues and show high glioma cytotoxicity.

side effects.title: Preparation and Characterization of Glucosamine Nanoparticle by Ionic Gelation Method Using Chitosan and Alginate
side effects.summary: Glucosamine nanoparticles can reduce insulin resistance and increase permeation, potentially benefiting patients with osteoarthritis.

side effects.title: Is there any scientific evidence for the use of glucosamine in the management of human osteoarthritis?
side effects.summary: Glucosamine is generally safe and no major adverse events have been reported so far.

side effects.title: Glucosamine sulfate in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis symptoms: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study using acetaminophen as a side comparator.
side effects.summary: Glucosamine sulfate at 1,500 mg once daily is more effective than placebo in treating knee osteoarthritis symptoms.

side effects.title: Role of glucosamine in osteoarthritis
side effects.summary: Glucosamine is known to relieve pain and decrease joint space narrowing in osteoarthritis of knee, with less side effects compared to anti-inflammatory drugs and placebos.

dosage.title: The effect of glucosamine supplementation on people experiencing regular knee pain
dosage.summary: Glucosamine supplementation at a dose of 2000 mg per day can provide some degree of pain relief and improved function in persons experiencing regular knee pain.

dosage.title: Glucosamine dose/concentration-effect correlation in the rat with adjuvant arthritis.
dosage.summary: The minimum effective dose of glucosamine in rats with adjuvant arthritis was approximately 40 mg/kg.day(-1).

dosage.title: Influence of glucose antimetabolites on the Walker tumor.
dosage.summary: Glucosamine hydrochloride dosages of 400-600 mg/rat/day and 2-deoxy-d-glucose dosages of 200 mg/rat/day showed antitumor effects in rats bearing Walker 256 tumors.

dosage.title: Medication-Taking Habit and Outcome of Glucosamine Sulfate for Osteoarthritis Patients Influenced by National Health Insurance Regulations in Taiwan
dosage.summary: The most common dosage of glucosamine sulfate for osteoarthritis patients is 250 mg 3 times a day for 3 months and discontinued for 3 months.

dosage.title: Effect of Glucosamine on Blood-brain Barrier Function during Experimental Autoimmune Encephalomyelitis in Rats
dosage.summary: Glucosamine at doses of 90 mg/(kgd) and 180 mg/(kgd) can decrease the blood-brain barrier integrity in experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis rats.

dosage.title: Glucosamine sulfate in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis symptoms: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study using acetaminophen as a side comparator.
dosage.summary: Glucosamine sulfate at the oral once-daily dosage of 1,500 mg is more effective than placebo in treating knee osteoarthritis symptoms.

dosage.title: Randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled glucosamine discontinuation trial in knee osteoarthritis.
dosage.summary: The study dosage of glucosamine was equivalent to the dosage taken prior to the study (maximum 1,500 mg/day).

dosage.title: Pharmacotherapeutic aspects of treating knee osteoarthritis with glucosamine sulfate
dosage.summary: A once-daily dosage of 1,500 mg of glucosamine sulfate is likely to be a safe, effective, and cost-effective treatment of knee osteoarthritis compared to placebo.

dosage.title: Crystalline glucosamine sulfate in the management of knee osteoarthritis: efficacy, safety, and pharmacokinetic properties
dosage.summary: Glucosamine sulfate 1500 mg once daily is recommended for managing knee osteoarthritis.

dosage.title: Intra‐articular delivery of glucosamine for treatment of experimental osteoarthritis created by a medial meniscectomy in a rat model
dosage.summary: The 350 Î14g dosage of glucosamine had the most significant positive impact on all components of the modified Mankin score.
